title: Is there a name for instrumentals such as these? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sometimes people call it indie pop or twee or emo-pop-it's kind of an evolution of punk to its antithesis. Soft voices, soft guitars, not a lot of production, no synths, real drums. Try listening to Belle and Sebastian, gentle waves, the field mice, camera obscura, the magnetic waves. There used to be a series of podcasts called” indiepop radio podcasts” No.1–14 that you could get on iTunes that had great stuff that I never heard anywhere else. A lot of the group are Scottish, though it's not an exclusively Scottish thing. They tend to be inspired by “kinder gentler” music from the 60s-Donovan, the Byrds, The Hollies. Also listen to later groups like World Party and the Mondays. Also worth hearing, The Free Design-The ultimate “kinder gentler” pop band. Hope this is what you're looking for :-)

The original question is: Is there a name for instrumentals such as these? My answer: The first one reminds me of Bon Iver. so that I think it could be classified as “indie folk”, while Paramore is classified as pop rock, pop punk or alternative rock.
